channel.title: 342 client/server development
channel.description:
I have recently acquired a 342 deob (thanks to Ethanofenjd) and have begun renaming it with Graham.
I have been developing a server that, as of now, only has login capabilities. It soon should have updating and game-packet handling.
[b]Client:[/b] http://subversion.assembla.com/svn/342refactor/ [b]Server:[/b] http://subversion.assembla.com/svn/openrs/
The client uses the 369 cache, as a 342 could not be located. You can find 342 protocol documentation on the RuneWiki (http://runewiki.grahamedgecombe.com/) if you wish. It is still incomplete for now

@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

Good luck blake, would be nice if you brought back a special something after 2 years cough using the 342 client and server.

Read full topic

item.title: 342 client/server development
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“light232, post:10, topic:295650”]Reactor.getSingleton().switchOp(socketChannel, SelectionKey.OP_READ);
in the handleRead void isnt necessary[/quote]Yes it is, look at the constructor. It switches the interested IO operation (to 0) so the demultiplexing thread stops flagging the same key over and over in the time it takes to initialize a new IO handler and thread. It must be switched back to read after done so we can continue waiting for data

[quote=“light232, post:8, topic:295650”]public static Reactor getSingleton() { try { return singleton == null ? singleton = new Reactor() : singleton; } catch (Exception ex) { logger.fatal("Could not initialize Reactor!", ex); } return null; }
u sure thats necessary?

y not just

private static final Reactor singleton = new Reactor();
know that a singleton is a design pattern, maybe rename the variable to instance, and the accessor to getInstance[/quote]
Initializing a Reactor may throw an IOException, and I wanted to make sure that it is caught properly. Never overlook proper exception handling. Also, I like to initialize singleton objects on the fly instead of everything at startup. I’m not sure why but I don’t like coupling declarations and initializations.

Read full topic

u sure thats necessary?

know that a singleton is a design pattern, maybe rename the variable to instance, and the accessor to getInstance
